title: Home

Sea breeze, warm bread, quiet streets, and modern history in one small coastal city.

        Crumb Quest Â· Your sweet and quiet journey through Gunsan

title: Gunsan Story
text:
A port city shaped by the sea, modern history, and quiet charm.
Gunsan is a coastal city on the west coast of Korea, where the Geum River meets the Yellow Sea.
Historically, it grew as a strategic trade port, and today it blends modern industry, island scenery, and cultural heritage into a unique landscape.



Gunsanâ€™s history changed significantly when it became an open port in 1899, allowing foreign tradeâ€”especially the export of rice from the Honam Plain.
During the Japanese occupation (1910â€“1945), the city developed rapidly as Japan built large-scale facilities:

Gunsan Customs House and old bank buildings in red brick

Warehouses and piers used for transporting rice

A floating pier that showed advanced engineering at the time

Today, these places remain part of Gunsanâ€™s Modern History District, turning the city into a kind of â€œopen-air museumâ€ of Koreaâ€™s modern era.




Gunsan is not just a portâ€”it is a city built in distinct layers, each representing a different face of the city.



The Gogunsan Islands, including Seonyudo, Munyeodo, and Sinsido

Island bridges and coastal roads with wide sea views

Famous sunset points and quiet beaches

Popular cycling and driving routes





The lower Geum River and its wide river mouth

Migratory birds visiting wetlands and estuaries

Eco-parks and observatories for birdwatching and nature walks





Old Japanese-style houses and warehouses mixed with new cafÃ©s

Retro streets like Gyeongam-dong Railroad Village

Small alleys, murals, and streets that are perfect for walking and taking photos







All images shown are AI-generated.






A calm view where the river meets the sea.





Red-brick buildings and old banks from Koreaâ€™s early modern era.








Bridges, sea, and island silhouettes against the sunset.





Retro alleys and an old railway turned into a photo-friendly street.

title: Gunsan Travel Guide
text:
About This Site
This website was created as a small guide to Gunsan.

Author: Park Haneul

Purpose: Introduce Gunsanâ€™s places, stories, bakeries, cafÃ©s, and local food.

Tools: Quarto, RStudio, simple HTML & CSS.

You can use this site as a travel reference, portfolio piece, or a practice project for web publishing.

title: Gunsan Story
text:
Gunsan is a place where:

History and everyday life exist side by side

The sea, river, and city connect in one landscape

Old traces are preserved while the city keeps changing

For visitors, Gunsan offers a balance of calm, sea breeze, modern history, and island scenery in one trip.
